name: 1,1,1,3,3,3-hexadeutero-2-propanone
Reason: 1,1,1,3,3,3-hexadeutero-2-propanone is a saturated hydrocarbon with a melting point of around -120 degrees Celsius. The presence of deuterium atoms in the molecule increases the molecular weight and size, which generally raises the melting point. However, the deuterium atoms also increase the hydrogen bonding potential due to their increased electronegativity. This can lead to a decrease in the melting point due to the increased hydrogen bonding. The effect of the deuterium atoms is more pronounced in the case of 1,1,1,3,3,3-hexadeutero-2-propanone due to the presence of a saturated hydrocarbon chain, which has a higher degree of hydrogen bonding compared to unsaturated hydrocarbons.
